page.title: 10Local Government in Eversley
page.content: {Eversley Parish Council}care mainly for maintenance of common land.They also care for footpaths, bridleways and the graveyard. At the meetings they discuss matters such as street lighting, planning applications and allotments. If they cannot deal with problems they pass them on to {Hart District Council.}They have two meetings a month, one main meeting that the public can go to and an open spaces meeting. A meeting can take up to three or four hours. There are eight members on the Parish Council. Six are men and two are women. A clerk is not included in the membership. They get about one complaint a month.The issues that they deal with are gravel extraction, the Eversley by-pass and the handing over of Blackbushe Airport to a large auction company.
